Package com.google.mu.util.stream

Class Cases

java.lang.Object
com.google.mu.util.stream.Cases
@Deprecated public final class Cases extends Object
Deprecated.
Use findFirstElements() and/or findOnlyElements() methods together with Optional.or(java.util.function.Supplier<? extends java.util.Optional<? extends T>>) instead.
Collectors for short streams with 0, 1 or 2 elements using a Supplier, Function or BiFunction respectively.

For example, if the input collection must have only 2 elements: 


 Foo result = input.stream().collect(onlyElements((a, b) -> ...));

Or, if the input may or may not have two elements: 


 Optional<Foo> result = input.stream().collect(when((a, b) -> ...));

Or, if the input could have zero, one or two elements: 


 Foo result = input.stream().collect(
     cases(
         when(() -> ...),
         when(a -> ...),
         when((a, b) -> ...)));
Since:
3.6

  • Method Details

    • onlyElement

      public static <T> Collector<T,?,T> onlyElement()
      Deprecated.
      A collector that collects the only element from the input, or else throws IllegalArgumentException.

    • onlyElements

      public static <T, R> Collector<T,?,R> onlyElements(BiFunction<? super T,? super T,? extends R> twoElements)
      Deprecated.
      A collector that collects the only two elements from the input and returns the result of applying the given twoElements function.

      The returned collector throws IllegalArgumentException otherwise.

    • when

      public static <R> Collector<Object,?,Optional<R>> when(Supplier<? extends R> noElement)
      Deprecated.
      A collector that wraps the result of noElement.get() in an Optional when the input is empty; or else returns Optional.empty(). For example: 
      
 return usageErrors.stream()
     .collect(when(() -> OK))
     .orElseThrow(() -> new UsageErrorException(usageErrors));

    • when

      public static <T, R> Collector<T,?,Optional<R>> when(Function<? super T,? extends R> onlyOne)
      Deprecated.
      A collector that wraps the result of applying the onlyOne function in an Optional when the input has only one element; or else returns Optional.empty(). For example: 
      
 return shards.stream()
     .collect(when(shard -> shard))
     .orElseGet(() -> flatten(shards));

    • when

      public static <T, R> Collector<T,?,Optional<R>> when(Predicate<? super T> condition, Function<? super T,? extends R> onlyOne)
      Deprecated.
      A collector that wraps the result of applying the onlyOne function in an Optional when the input has only one element and it satisfies condition in terms of Predicate.test(T); or else returns Optional.empty(). For example: 
      
 return statuses.stream()
     .collect(when(OK::equals, s -> result))
     .orElseThrow(...);

    • when

      public static <T, R> Collector<T,?,Optional<R>> when(BiFunction<? super T,? super T,? extends R> onlyTwo)
      Deprecated.
      A collector that wraps the result of applying the onlyTwo function in an Optional when the input has only two elements; or else returns Optional.empty(). For example: 
      
 return nameParts.stream()
     .collect(when(QualifiedName::new))  // (namespace, name) ->
     .orElseThrow(() -> new SyntaxException(...));

    • when

      public static <T, R> Collector<T,?,Optional<R>> when(BiPredicate<? super T,? super T> condition, BiFunction<? super T,? super T,? extends R> onlyTwo)
      Deprecated.
      A collector that wraps the result of applying the onlyTwo function in an Optional when the input has only two elements and the two elements satify condition in terms of BiPredicate.test(T, U); or else returns Optional.empty(). For example: 
      
 return nameParts.stream()
     .collect(when((namespace, name) -> !invalid.contains(namespace), QualifiedName::new))
     .orElseThrow(() -> new SyntaxException(...));

    • cases

      @SafeVarargs public static <T, R> Collector<T,?,R> cases(Collector<? super T,?,? extends Optional<? extends R>>... cases)
      Deprecated.
      Combines multiple Optional-returning collector cases, to collect to the first non-empty result. For example: 
      
 Name name = nameParts.stream()
     .collect(
         cases(
             when(QualifiedName::new),                // (namespace, name) ->
             when(keywords::contains, Keyword::new),  // (keyword) ->
             when(UnqualifiedName::new)               // (name) ->
             when(Anonymous::new)));                  // () ->
      Since:
      5.3

    • switching

      @Deprecated @SafeVarargs public static <T, R> Collector<T,?,R> switching(Collector<? super T,?,? extends Optional<? extends R>>... cases)
      Deprecated.
      Use cases(java.util.stream.Collector<? super T, ?, ? extends java.util.Optional<? extends R>>...) instead.
